p: Mean electricity price over 2010 to 2013 in IEA countries was US$ 32.78 +/− 9.67 GJ −1 (1 s.d.) (equivalent to 11.8 +/− 3.5 c kWh −1), industrial price before tax 39. The lowest price was 14.59 USD GJ −1 (Norway), and the highest was 56.32 USD GJ −1 (Italy). However, power generation in Norway is currently over 90% hydro-electricity and may, therefore, be unrepresentative of prices for biomass energy. The next lowest price was in the USA, at 17.88 USD GJ −1, which was therefore used as the lower bound of the range. In all, 2014 electricity prices were, accordingly, assumed to lay in the range 14.6–56.3 USD GJ −1. Electricity prices to 2100 were estimated to rise linearly at 1.9–2.1 % of 2014 values per year 40.
